Margaret,
 
the enhancement that was done on the images was used for tryin=
g to bring the image forward out of the glare 
the suns reflection caused. =
The technique was developed out of necessity. The discovery of the imageing=
 process 
and the development of the enhancement process is mine.
 
I never=
 added or removed any features or detail from those images, the only enhanc=
ement was done to brightness, contrast
and levels. All of these control the=
 light and dark of the image they promote the toning down of the glare to e=
nhance and bring out
the details of the image. 
 
I have never denied that =
I enhanced them, I even posted before and after comparison pics on IAH so t=
hat everyone could see
what was acomplished with the enhancement process, a=
nd that the image could be seen in the original capture but the glare preve=
nted
seeing any detail. I had at times actually sat and watched as a spirit=
 face turned it's face and looked directly at me.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 

=

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: ITCdeadpeople@...: Fri, 11 Apr 20=
08 20:12:33 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: For Margaret(itc imaging)




Hi Br=
uce. My link is www.ITCdeadpeople.comI saw your VPI work. The images were v=
ery cool. I don't have photoshop, although I did take note of your process =
somewhere in case I ever get it. I saw it on another person's site as well,=
 so I never was sure if you had copied that person's technique, or they had=
 copied yours. All I remember thinking is, boy, that's a whole lot of steps=
 to go through to get to the final impressive images, and I wondered what m=
ade whichever one of you came up with it, think to try all those steps. I d=
o remember that cat! As well as some other really clear images. :-)Margaret=
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "bhali333" <paranormalinvestigating@...> wr=
ote:>> > Margaret,> > Before I became engrossed in box research I had done =
tons of research > with every method of ITC imaging.> > I did Video Loop, w=
ater reflection, crystal, mirror, you name it.> And got pretty good results=
 from most.> > My most astounding visual itc came from a dicovery in my hom=
e.> I have a crystal window in the front door of my house facing west, > wh=
en the sun starts to go down it shines through this crystal window > and pr=
ojects onto the walls in my family room.> > I was sitting watching tv one d=
ay and happenned to look over at > something that caught my attention, when=
 I looked over there was a > face looking back. I ran to get my digital cam=
era and that started a > year long process of experiments and spirit images=
 I name VPI (visual > projection imaging) I have literally hundreds of deta=
iled images of > spirits that where reflected through the crystal onto the =
walls in my > home. as far as I can discern the spirits were forming the im=
ages > inside of the crystal window, and the sun was acting as sort of a > =
slide or movie projecter. Projecting their images onto the walls when > it =
came through the window.> > I had a page on I am haunted for the longest ti=
me, and drew quite a > following for my images. Alas since I discovered box=
 research I have > not done one imaging session.> > What got my attention w=
as the mention of the horse image. I also > captured the image of a horse, =
very detailed and a cat that you would > think was sitting right in the roo=
m.> > Maragaret, please post the link to your site I did not get it and I >=
 would love to take a look.> > If anyone is interested let me know and I'll=
 post some of my images.> > Bruce>

Margaret,<BR>
 <BR>
the enhancement that was done on the i=
mages was used for trying to bring the image forward out of the glare <BR>
=
the suns reflection caused. The technique was developed out of necessity. T=
he discovery of the imageing process <BR>
and the development of the enhanc=
ement process is mine.<BR>
 <BR>
I never added or removed any features=
 or detail from those images, the only enhancement was done to brightn=
ess, contrast<BR>
and levels. All of these control the light and dark of th=
e image they promote the toning down of the glare to enhance and bring out<=
BR>
the details of the image. <BR>
 <BR>
I have never denied that I en=
hanced them, I even posted before and after comparison pics on IAH so that =
everyone could see<BR>
what was acomplished with the enhancement process, a=
nd that the image could be seen in the original capture but the glare preve=
nted<BR>
seeing any detail. I had at times actually sat and watched as a sp=
irit face turned it's face and looked directly at me.<BR>
 <BR>
Bruce<=
BR><BR><BR>
